metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3574 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: Apache POI before 3.10.1 and 3.11.x before 3.11-beta2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption and crash) via a crafted OOXML file, aka an XML Entity Expansion (XEE) attack.

criterions.comment: libapache-poi-java: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
